intro: Encyclia garzonensis, commonly known as the Garzón orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Colombia. It belongs to the Epidendroideae subfamily and is characterized by its sympodial growth habit. The plant produces dark green, strap-shaped leaves and bears fragrant, yellowish-green flowers with a distinctive purple lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
